titles.title: To direct the Administrator of General Services to install a photovoltaic system for the headquarters building of the Department of Energy.
To direct the Administrator of General Services to install a photovoltaic system for the headquarters building of the Department of Energy.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.
Reported by the Committee on Transportation. H. Rept. 110-11.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 4.

action.text: Mr. Oberstar moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 798.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Environment and Public Works.
Committee on Environment and Public Works. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.
Committee on Environment and Public Works. Reported by Senator Boxer without amendment. With written report No. 110-224.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 475.

action.text: Provisions of Measure Incorporated into Title V, Subtitle C, Section 521 of H.R. 6.

bill.summary:
(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The expanded summary of the House passed version is repeated here.))
Directs the Administrator of General Services to install a photovoltaic system, as set forth in the Sun Wall Design Project, for the headquarters building of the Department of Energy located at 1000 Independence Avenue, Southwest, Washington, D.C., commonly known as the Forrestal Building. Authorizes funding from the Federal Buildings Fund.
